abstract: Environmental Protection Agency and Justice Dept reach settlement with Duke Energy in 15-year legal battle over utility's failure to install modern pollution-control equipment on coal-fired plants; under agreement, Duke will pay fine of nearly $1 million and will spend additional $4.4 million on environmental programs.
lead_paragraph: The settlement requires the company, the nation’s largest electric utility, to pay a $975,000 fine and spend $4.4 million on environmental programs.

headline.main: Duke Energy to Pay Fine Over Power Plant Violations
headline.print_headline: Largest U.S. Electric Utility to Pay Fine Over Power Plant Rules Violations
